title: Smoking down, number of lives saved up as more countries embrace tobacco control measures

title_detail.value: Smoking down, number of lives saved up as more countries embrace tobacco control measures

summary: Between 2008 and 2014, more than 53 million people in 88 countries stopped smoking due to tobacco control measures, which means that more than 22 million smoking-related deaths have been averted, say authors of a new report.

summary_detail.value: Between 2008 and 2014, more than 53 million people in 88 countries stopped smoking due to tobacco control measures, which means that more than 22 million smoking-related deaths have been averted, say authors of a new report.
